intro: Trixis pallida, commonly known as the pale trixis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Trixis pallida is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in shrublands and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
